intro: Wahlenbergia gracilis var. pygmaea, commonly known as the dwarf bluebell, is a compact, flowering plant native to South Africa. It produces delicate, sky-blue to violet flowers that bloom in spring and summer. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and is often found growing in rocky or sandy soils. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family, which includes many bell-shaped flowering plants. Due to its small size and ornamental flowers, it is popular in rock gardens and as a bedding plant.
